#Text=UN report says 80 per cent of world 's refugees live in poor countries
#Text=Wednesday , June 22 , 2011
#Text=UNHCR aid delivered to Kenya .
#Text=Image : DoD photo by : TSgt Steve Staedler .

#Text=Reflecting an " overwhelming imbalance " , the majority of the world 's forcibly displaced refugees have been taken in by poor , developing countries , not industrialized countries , according to the 2010 Global Trends report by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees ( UNHCR ) released on Monday .

column3:
abstract[18]	new[18]	_	_

5-6	213-214

column1: #Text=The report states that many of the poorest countries in the world have accommodated the largest numbers of refugees in absolute terms and also in proportion to their economies .
#Text=Nyanzale , in the Masisi , Congo refugee camp .
#Text=Image : Julien Harneis .
#Text=There were 43.7 million people displaced worldwide at the end of 2010 , according to the report , more than half children .
#Text=UNHCR works in over 120 countries and includes both refugees forced to flee a country as well as those forced out of areas in their own country .

#Text=The global total is broken down into the following categories : 15.4 million refugees , 27.5 million internally displaced people , and another 840,000 people awaiting to be assigned to refugee status .
#Text=In addition , there are an estimated 12 million stateless people around the world ; people who lack even the basic identity of a nationality .
#Text=Since 2004 , the reported numbers of stateless populations has steadily increased .
#Text=According to the report , Pakistan 's 1.9 million refugee population is the largest , followed by Iran with 1.1 million and Syria with 1 million .
#Text=The neighboring nations of Afghanistan and Iraq accounted for the largest number of people fleeing .
#Text=The report states :

#Text=" Pakistan also has the biggest economic impact with 710 refugees for each US dollar of its per capita Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) , followed by Democratic Republic of the Congo and Kenya with 475 and 247 refugees respectively .

#Text= We are also concerned with the 7m people in protracted situations who are living in camps for more than 10 years , sometimes even 30 years .
